ai-ud6.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud6.6:1.3_0: Now at that time several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who followed various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī, holding different views and opinions, relying on different views.
ai-ud6.6:2.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:2.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are eternal.”
ai-ud6.6:3.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:3.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are not eternal.”
ai-ud6.6:4.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:4.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are both eternal and not eternal.”
ai-ud6.6:5.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:5.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are neither eternal nor not eternal.”
ai-ud6.6:6.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:6.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by oneself.”
ai-ud6.6:7.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:7.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by another.”
ai-ud6.6:8.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:8.2_0: “The self and the cosmos are made by both oneself and another.”
ai-ud6.6:9.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:9.2_0: “Pleasure and pain have arisen by chance, not made by oneself or another, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:10.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:10.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are eternal, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:11.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:11.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are not eternal, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:12.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:12.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are both eternal and not eternal, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:13.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:13.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are neither eternal nor not eternal, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:14.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:14.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are made by oneself, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:15.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:15.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are made by another, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:16.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:16.2_0: “Pleasure and pain are made by both oneself and another, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:17.1_0: There were some ascetics and brāhmaṇas who were of this argument, this view:
ai-ud6.6:17.2_0: “Pleasure and pain have arisen by chance, not made by oneself or another, and the self and the cosmos.”
ai-ud6.6:18.1_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words:
ai-ud6.6:18.3_0: Such is not Truth, such is Truth!”
ai-ud6.6:19.1_0: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-ud6.6:19.2_0: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went to the Buddha,
ai-ud6.6:19.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud6.6:20.1_0: “Sir, here several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who follow various other paths were residing in Sāvatthī, holding different views and opinions, relying on different views.
ai-ud6.6:21.1_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
ai-ud6.6:21.2_0: the self and the cosmos are eternal,
ai-ud6.6:21.3_0: They were arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words:
ai-ud6.6:21.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.6:22.1_0: “The wanderers who follow other paths are blind and sightless.
ai-ud6.6:22.2_0: They don't understand what is beneficial or what is not beneficial, nor what is the truth and what is not the truth.
ai-ud6.6:22.3_0: That’s why they are arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words.
ai-ud6.6:22.5_0: Such is not Truth, such is!’”
ai-ud6.6:23.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud6.6:24.1_0: “This generation is intent on the I-maker,
ai-ud6.6:24.3_0: There are some who do not realize this,
ai-ud6.6:24.4_0: they do not see the dart.
ai-ud6.6:25.1_0: Since they’ve already seen this dart,
ai-ud6.6:25.2_0: they do not think, ‘I make it’,
ai-ud6.6:26.1_0: These folk are caught up in conceit,
ai-ud6.6:26.2_0: tied by conceit, schackled by conceit.
ai-ud6.6:26.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
